title: Schuler Benson met his future wife after Facebook glitch logged him into her account | The
text:
FOR most of us a mobile phone glitch is no more than an annoyance but for one man it turned out to be his portal to true love.
Six years ago Schuler Benson switched on his phone to find that he had been accidentally logged into someone else’s Facebook account.
The other person, Celeste Zendler, was a total stranger to Mr Benson and lived in Boulder, Colorado, 1,600km from Mr Benson’s South Arkansas home.
Online date ... The fateful Facebook encounter. Picture: Schuler Benson/Imgur Source: Supplied
According to Mr Benson the two “had no mutual friends in real life or online, shared no Facebook interests”.
But for an entire week every time he logged into to his phone “I found myself in Celeste’s account”.
Eventually he was able to logout but days later Ms Zendler sent him a friend request.
Mr Benson said: “It turns out we had a lot in common.
Lots in common ... The couple became close friends after the accidental meeting. Picture: Schuler Benson/Imgur Source: Supplied
“Like, a LOT in common. We became close friends online, and finally met in person in June of 2013.
“In the fall of 2013, she relocated from Colorado to live with me in Arkansas.”
This past summer the couple were married.
“I found my partner, my best friend, my great love via a simple glitch in social media,” said Mr Benson, whose story went viral after he posted it on Imgur . “There are awful things in this world, but sometimes there’s beauty, too. This is my beauty.”
A thing of beauty ... The couple wed this summer. Picture: Schuler Benson/Imgur Source: Supplied
